Detailed Description

Assert macro.

Author:
Marc Parizeau
Revision
1.18
Date
1970/01/23 01:42:13

This macro can be used to assert the validity of a boolean condition (first argument: COND). If the expression is true nothing happens. Otherwise, an error message (second argument: MESSAGE) is outputted with the file name and line number where the macro was executed, and the program exits. On Unix, the message is send to the standard error stream (std::cerr). On windows, a popup (message box) is created with the error message.
